12:36 AM PDT We are investigating elevated errors for requests made to Amazon S3 in the US-STANDARD Region.
1:00 AM PDT We are working to determine root cause of the elevated error rates and latencies for Amazon S3 in the US-STANDARD Region.
1:08 AM PDT We believe we have identified the root cause of the elevated error rates and latencies for requests to the US-STANDARD Region and are working to resolve the issue.
1:52 AM PDT We are actively working on the recovery process, focusing on multiple steps in parallel. While we are in recovery, customers will continue to see elevated error rate and latencies.
2:38 AM PDT We continue to execute on our recovery plan and have taken multiple steps to reduce latencies and error rates for Amazon S3 in US-STANDARD. Customers may continue to experience elevated latencies and error rates as we proceed through our recovery plan.
3:25 AM PDT We are still working through our recovery plan.
3:36 AM PDT We are beginning to see recovery in error rates and latencies for Amazon S3.
3:46 AM PDT Between 12:08 AM and 3:40 AM PDT, Amazon S3 experienced elevated error rates and latencies. We identified the root cause and pursued multiple paths to recovery. The error has been corrected and the service is operating normally.
5:52 AM PDT Between 12:08 AM and 3:40 AM PDT in the Amazon S3 US-STANDARD Region (i.e. US-East), Amazon S3 experienced elevated error rates due to a configuration error in one of the systems that Amazon S3 uses to manage request traffic. We pursued the wrong root cause initially, which prompted us to try restorative actions that didn't solve the issue. Once we understood the real root cause, we resolved the issue relatively quickly and restored normal operations. During the time of the event, the elevated S3 API error rate led to impact on services that depend on Amazon S3 such as EMR which relies on S3 for object storage and EC2 which relies on S3 to store some AMIs.
12:28 PM PDT Between 12:03 PM to 12:19 PM PDT we experienced elevated errors for requests made to Amazon S3 in the US-STANDARD Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

DescribeInstanceStatus API Errors

3:07 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for the DescribeInstanceStatus API in the US-EAST-1 Region.
3:36 PM PDT We can confirm increased error rates for the DescribeInstanceStatus API in the US-EAST-1 Region and are working to resolve this issue.

Because of these error rates, the AWS Management Console is reporting "Unable to describe instance status" and alarms based on instance health status may be incorrectly triggered. This issue impacts the reporting of instance status using this API, however instances are healthy and operating normally. New instance launches are also operating normally.
5:29 PM PDT We have identified the root cause of the issue causing elevated error rates for the DescribeInstanceStatus API and are working to resolve the issue. This issue impacts the reporting of instance status using this API, however instances are healthy and operating normally. New instance launches are also operating normally.
5:49 PM PDT Between 2:41 PM and 5:34 PM PDT we experienced elevated error rates for the DescribeInstanceStatus API in the US-EAST-1 Region. This API is now operating normally. Instances were healthy and operating normally throughout this event.

Network Connectivity

10:00 PM PDT We are investigating connectivity issues for newly launched instances and increased Elastic IP mapping latencies in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region.
10:32 PM PDT We have identified the root cause of the issue affecting connectivity for newly launched instances and increased Elastic IP mapping latencies in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region, and are working on resolving the issue.
11:27 PM PDT We continue to work on resolving the issue affecting connectivity for newly launched instances and increased Elastic IP mapping latencies in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Instances in other Availability Zones as well as existing instances in the affected Availability Zone are not impacted by this event. The AWS Management Console has been updated to indicate which Availability Zone is experiencing the issue.
Sep 18, 12:20 AM PDT Between 7:35 PM and 11:55 PM PDT we experienced connectivity issues for newly launched instances and increased Elastic IP mapping latencies in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. Instances in other Availability Zones as well as existing instances in the affected Availability Zone were not impacted by this event. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:00 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region.
3:26 AM PDT We are continuing to see increased error rates for all API calls in DynamoDB in US-East-1. We are actively working on resolving the issue.
4:05 AM PDT We have identified the source of the issue. We are working on the recovery.
4:41 AM PDT We continue to work towards recovery of the issue causing increased error rates for the DynamoDB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region.
4:52 AM PDT We want to give you more information about what is happening. The root cause began with a portion of our metadata service within DynamoDB. This is an internal sub-service which manages table and partition information. Our recovery efforts are now focused on restoring metadata operations. We will be throttling APIs as we work on recovery.
5:22 AM PDT We can confirm that we have now throttled APIs as we continue to work on recovery.
5:42 AM PDT We are seeing increasing stability in the metadata service and continue to work towards a point where we can begin removing throttles.
6:19 AM PDT The metadata service is now stable and we are actively working on removing throttles.
7:12 AM PDT We continue to work on removing throttles and restoring API availability but are proceeding cautiously.
7:22 AM PDT We are continuing to remove throttles and enable traffic progressively.
7:40 AM PDT We continue to remove throttles and are starting to see recovery.
7:50 AM PDT We continue to see recovery of read and write operations and continue to work on restoring all other operations.
8:16 AM PDT We are seeing significant recovery of read and write operations and continue to work on restoring all other operations.
9:12 AM PDT Between 2:13 AM and 8:15 AM PDT we experienced high error rates for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

Additional details can be found here.

5:15 AM PDT We continue to work to resolve the increased error rates for EBS APIs, Spot Instance APIs, and new EC2 instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. In addition, we are experiencing increased error rates accessing VPC endpoints for S3, and Instance Status CloudWatch metrics are reporting INSUFFICIENT_DATA for some instances. Instance connectivity and EBS volume performance are not affected.
6:45 AM PDT We continue to work to resolve the issue in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are currently experiencing impact on a few dimensions: error rates for the EBS APIs and Spot Instance APIs are elevated; new EC2 instance launches are experiencing delays and elevated error rates; we are also experiencing increased error rates accessing VPC endpoints for S3; and Instance Status CloudWatch metrics are reporting INSUFFICIENT_DATA for some instances. Instance connectivity and EBS volume performance are not affected.
7:43 AM PDT Error rates for impacted APIs are beginning to recover and new instance launches are starting to succeed. We continue to work on restoring full service functionality.
8:19 AM PDT Between 2:13 AM and 8:07 AM PST EC2 experienced impact in the US-EAST-1 Region on a few dimensions: error rates for the EBS APIs and Spot Instance APIs were elevated; new EC2 instance launches experienced delays and elevated error rates; we experienced increased error rates accessing VPC endpoints for S3; VPC Flow Logs were delayed; and Instance Status CloudWatch metrics reported INSUFFICIENT_DATA for some instances. Instance connectivity and EBS volume performance were not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:19 AM PDT Between 6:44 AM PDT and 7:45 AM PDT we experienced increased API error rates for AppStream in the US-EAST-1 Region.The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

7:06 AM PDT We are experiencing login issues and elevated error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 region. We are working toward resolution.
8:06 AM PDT We are beginning to see recovery for login, error rates, and latencies. We are continuing to work on fully restoring the service
8:32 AM PDT Between 2:16 AM PDT and 7:41 AM PDT, we experienced elevated login issues, error rates, and latencies in the US-EAST-1 region. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

10:29 AM PDT Between 2:40 AM and 7:45 AM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. CloudSearch resolved API issues, however, creating new domains and indexing operations functionality are still unavailable in US-EAST-1. Existing search domains continue to serve search queries. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

2:25 PM PDT We've heard from a small number of customers that they're still experiencing heightened error rates on DynamoDB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. We’ve investigated this and seen that one of the metadata partitions is not taking as much traffic as expected and, for a small subset of those customers with keys that reside on this partition, their error rates are higher than normal. We’re working on resolving this as soon as possible.
5:03 PM PDT We’re continuing to work on restoring full traffic to the affected partition to resolve the increased DynamoDB API error rates some customers have seen in the US-EAST-1 Region. We’re doing this carefully to make sure the fix behaves as expected.
7:23 PM PDT We have updated the metadata service with a fix to restore full traffic to the affected partition. We are seeing significant reduction in error rates some customers experienced earlier in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:48 PM PDT We are continuing to work towards resolving the small number of remaining customer tables that are facing elevated error rates.
11:25 PM PDT The fix we deployed several hours ago to the metadata service worked as expected, and the partition that was previously not taking full traffic is now doing so. The service is now operating normally.

6:33 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region.
7:25 AM PDT We continue to investigate the increased latency and errors for the DynamoDB metadata service. The team is rolling out the remaining mitigations that have been developed to mitigate the errors we encountered earlier this week.
9:26 AM PDT We continue to actively work on deploying mitigations to address the increased latencies and error rates for API requests. We have seen improvements in both request latencies and error rates.
11:13 AM PDT Between 5:12 AM and 9:21 AM PDT, we experienced periods of increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. API request errors and latencies have recovered but we will keep this event open while we continue to monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations that have been developed to mitigate the errors we encountered earlier this week. We may see further periods of low error rates as we continue to deploy these mitigations and will continue to provide updates.
12:04 PM PDT One of our mitigations has increased error rates and latencies for some tables. We are actively working to resolve these.
2:30 PM PDT Between 10:31 AM and 1:30 PM we experienced periods of increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. API request errors and latencies have recovered and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
5:13 PM PDT We can confirm that the elevated error rates and latencies for the DynamoDB APIs have recovered in the US-EAST-1 Region. The mitigations deployed up to this point have stabilized the service and we will continue to rollout additional mitigations as described in the summary of events from earlier in the week: https://aws.amazon.com/message/5467D2 . The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:33 AM PDT We are currently experiencing elevated error rates for the Auto Scaling Service in the US-EAST-1 Region. Currently running instances in the Auto Scaling groups are not impacted.
7:35 AM PDT The API error rates for Auto Scaling are recovering in the US-EAST-1 Region due to mitigations being deployed by the DynamoDB team. Existing instances were unaffected, and scaling activities are succeeding.
8:28 AM PDT We continue to see periods of increased API error rates for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are working closely with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors, and scaling activities are succeeding.
9:21 AM PDT We continue to see periods of increased API error rates and scaling activity delays for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to work with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed. Existing instances remain unaffected by the errors.
9:54 AM PDT We are seeing improvements in the API error rates for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region due to mitigations being deployed by the DynamoDB team. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors, and scaling activities are succeeding.
12:41 PM PDT We continue to see periods of increased API error rates and scaling activity delays for Auto Scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to work with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors.
2:37 PM PDT Between 11:23 AM and 1:30 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased API error rates and delayed scaling activities in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were unaffected by the errors. The service is now operating normally, and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
3:58 PM PDT We can confirm that the elevated API error rates and scaling activity delays have been resolved. Existing instances were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:01 AM PDT We are currently experiencing increased EBS API error rates, and increased errors for new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region.
8:38 AM PDT We are currently experiencing increased EBS API error rates, and increased errors for new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances and volumes are not impacted.
10:45 AM PDT We have seen improvements in EBS API error rates. API errors may have resulted in delays terminating some instances. EBS volume performance was not impacted.
12:44 PM PDT We continue to experience elevated API error rates for the EBS APIs and the RunInstances API in the US-EAST-1 Region. Running instances and EBS volume performance are not impacted.
2:48 PM PDT Between 11:14 AM and 2:04 PM PDT we experienced elevated error rates for the EBS APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. While EBS API error rates have recovered, we continue to see a low level of errors for the RunInstances API. Running instances and EBS volume performance remain unaffected.
3:04 PM PDT All API error rates have recovered in the US-EAST-1 Region. We continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
4:01 PM PDT We can confirm that the elevated error rates for the EBS and RunInstances APIs have recovered. Running instances and EBS volume performance were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased API error rates and provisioning latencies
archive.description:
8:35 AM PDT We can confirm increased API error rates as well as provisioning and scaling latencies for some environments in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:15 AM PDT Between 6:05 AM and 9:16 AM PDT, customers experienced elevated API error rates and delays in environment creation and deployment operations in the US-EAST-1 Region. The service is operating normally.
12:57 PM PDT We can confirm increased API latencies and delays in provisioning, scaling and deployment operations in the US-EAST-1 Region.
2:42 PM PDT Between 1:00 PM and 2:10 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased API latencies and delays in provisioning, scaling, and deployment operations in the US-EAST-1 Region. The API latencies and delays have recovered and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor and deploy the remaining mitigations.
3:53 PM PDT We can confirm recovery for increased API error rates and latencies as well as delays in provisioning, scaling and deployment operations. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:43 AM PDT We are investigating increased latencies for processing some alarms in the US-EAST-1 Region.
11:16 AM PDT Between 6:05 AM and 9:16 AM PDT, customers may have experienced some delayed alarms in the US-EAST-1 Region. The service is operating normally.

1:06 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latency impacting all Data Pipeline APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. Active Pipeline Activities are progressing but are in some cases delayed. Customers can expect intermittent delays view Pipeline status in the Data Pipeline AWS console.
2:45 PM PDT Between 11:10 AM and 1:30 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased error rates and latencies for API requests in the US-EAST-1 Region. API request errors and latencies have recovered and we continue to keep this event open as we monitor.
3:56 PM PDT We can confirm that latencies and error rates have recovered on all Data Pipeline APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. As a result of the previous errors, running Pipeline Activities may have been delayed or timed out. If timed out Activities exceeded their 'maximumRetries' users may see a status of failed. In such cases, please review the output of those Activities to confirm their status. You can “Rerun” failed Activities in the Execution Details of your Console. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

1:21 PM PDT We are investigating increased API error rates and event processing latency in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are working closely with the DynamoDB team as mitigations are deployed.
2:34 PM PDT We are seeing improvements in both error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region due to mitigations deployed by the DynamoDB team.
3:20 PM PDT Between 1:04 PM and 1:39 PM PDT we experienced periods of increased API error rates and latencies in the US-EAST-1 Region. During this time, new Lambda functions experienced increased provisioning latencies, resulting in invocation errors. Recently executed functions were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased error rates and instance launch latency
archive.description: 2:57 PM PDT Between 2:03 PM and 2:33 PM PDT, Auto Scaling experienced elevated API error rates and instance launch times in the US-EAST-1 Region. Existing instances were not affected. The service is now operating normally.

9:00 PM PDT We are currently investigating elevated error rates for the AWS Management Console.
9:23 PM PDT Between 7:55 PM and 9:12 PM PDT the AWS Management Console experienced elevated error rates. The errors have recovered and the AWS Management Console is now operating normally.

5:14 AM PDT We are investigating a period of elevated error rates for the EC2 APIs and new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. During this period some instances experienced impaired connectivity and some EBS volumes experienced degraded IO performance in a single Availability Zone.
6:05 AM PDT Between 4:34 AM and 4:52 AM PDT we experienced elevated error rates for the EC2 APIs and new instance launches in the US-EAST-1 Region. During this period some instances experienced impaired connectivity and some EBS volumes experienced degraded IO performance in a single Availability Zone. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:47 AM PDT We experienced a period of connectivity issues affecting some instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The problem has been resolved and recovery is proceeding.
6:48 AM PDT Between 4:34 AM and 4:52 AM PDT we experienced connectivity issues affecting some database instances in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The majority of these recovered when the networking connectivity issue was resolved and we continue towards full recovery for the remaining Single-AZ database instances.
7:14 AM PDT We can confirm that all database instances have fully recovered. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:09 AM PDT Between 4:34 AM and 4:52 AM PDT we experienced network connectivity issues for some load balancers in a single Availability Zone. Health checks to back-end instances in the affected Availability Zone also saw impact. Request traffic was shifted away from the affected Availability Zone during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

6:41 AM PDT We are investigating a period of connectivity issues affecting some nodes in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The problem has been resolved and recovery is proceeding.
7:31 AM PDT Between 4:34 AM and 7:15 AM PDT we experienced connectivity issues affecting some nodes in a single Availability Zone in the US-EAST-1 Region. The majority of these recovered when the networking issue was resolved at 4:52 AM PDT and we can confirm that all nodes have now fully recovered. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

8:39 PM PDT We are investigating increased EBS API error rates in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.
8:53 PM PDT Between 07:23 PM and 08:40 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for the EBS APIs in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.

10:51 AM PDT Between 10:18 AM and 10:38 AM PDT, users experienced increased errors while accessing IAM in the AWS Management Console. The issue has been resolved and the Console is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated API faults and latencies in US-WEST-2
archive.description:
6:14 PM PDT We can confirm elevated CloudWatch API faults and delayed metrics in US-WEST-2 Region. Customers querying data for the time range up to 5:35 PM PDT are experiencing elevated fault rates when calling the GetMetricStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region. These metrics are delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on the delayed metrics may have transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. The service is processing all new metrics normally. We are working to recover the delayed metric data.
7:05 PM PDT We are continuing to work to recover the affected metric data prior to 5:35 PM PDT. The service is processing all new metrics normally and alarms are unaffected.
8:04 PM PDT Between 4:54 PM PDT and 7:41 PM PDT, customers experienced an elevated fault rate when calling the GetMetricStatistics API in the US-WEST-2 Region. Some metrics were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The service is operating normally.

11:20 AM PDT Between 10:20 and 10:40 AM PDT customers experienced elevated error rates when accessing the CloudFront API and CloudFront Management Console. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally. End-user requests for content from our edge locations were not affected by this issue.

9:39 PM PDT We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for the ELB APIs in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region.
9:56 PM PDT We have identified the root cause of the increased error rates and latencies in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. Connectivity to existing load balancers is not affected.
10:23 PM PDT The increased error rates and latencies for the ELB APIs have been resolved but we continue to see increased provisioning and back-end instance registration times. Connectivity to existing load balancers remains unaffected.
10:44 PM PDT Between 9:22 PM and 10:07 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates and latencies for the ELB APIs and Management Console in the AP-NORTHEAST-1 Region. Connectivity for existing load balancers was unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

At 3:00 PM PDT we began to see some recovery in the error rates which recovered fully at 4:10 PM PDT. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:26 AM PST We continue to work to resolve the delays affecting some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region.
5:17 AM PST We confirm continued delays to some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We continue to work to resolve the issue.
5:55 AM PST We confirm continued delays to some CloudWatch metrics in the US-WEST-2 Region. We continue to work to resolve the issue.

During that time, alarms on delayed metrics may have transitioned into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics are in the process of backfilling in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The CloudWatch service is operating normally.

6:47 AM PST We are investigating packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region.
7:36 AM PST We can confirm intermittent packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region. An external facility providing Direct Connect connectivity to the EU-WEST-1 Region has experienced power loss. We are working with the service provider to mitigate impact and restore power.
8:23 AM PST We have recovered power in the impacted facility and are continuing to investigate and resolve intermittent packet loss and latency between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region.
8:36 AM PST Between 5:40 AM and 8:20 AM PST we experienced packet loss between the Direct Connect location at TelecityGroup, London Docklands, and the EU-WEST-1 Region. An external facility providing Direct Connect connectivity to the EU-WEST-1 Region experienced power loss. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

3:31 PM PST Between 2:26 PM and 2:55 PM PST in the US-EAST-1 Region, customers experienced elevated error rates sending email to the SES SMTP interface. During that time, a portion of requests failed with a temporary authentication failure. Requests to the SES HTTP interface were unaffected, and all requests accepted successfully by SES have been processed normally. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased VPC endpoint error rates for S3
archive.description: 3:40 PM PST Between 2:26 PM and 2:55 PM PST we experienced increased error rates accessing VPC endpoints for S3 in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

5:08 PM PST Between 1:10 PM and 4:50 PM PST AWS Lambda experienced elevated invocation error rates, including errors in new function creation in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have corrected the cause of the errors and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated Request Timeouts from a Single Edge Location
archive.description: 12:56 PM PST Between 11:59 AM and 12:23 PM PST, some customers experienced request timeouts from a single edge location in Australia. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased latency on stack create, delete and update.
archive.description:
4:11 AM PST We are experiencing increased latencies for creating, deleting and updating CloudFormation stacks in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
4:57 AM PST We are working on resolving the root cause for elevated latencies for creating, deleting and updating CloudFormation stacks in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
5:26 AM PST From 2:45 AM to 4:05 AM PST customers experienced increased latencies when creating, deleting and updating CloudFormation stacks in the EU-WEST-1 region. The service has recovered and all queued stack create, update and delete requests are now being processed and the service is operating normally.

4:33 AM PST We can confirm delays in environment creation, termination, and deployment operations in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
5:05 AM PST We are seeing reduced delays in environment creation, termination, and deployment operations in the EU-WEST-1 Region. We will continue to work on resolving the delays fully.

3:19 PM PST We are currently investigating network connectivity issues affecting one of two redundant tunnels for some VPN customers in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
3:26 PM PST Between 2:24 PM and 3:16 PM PST, we experienced connectivity issues affecting one of our redundant VPN gateway devices in the EU-WEST-1 Region. Each VPN connection is provisioned as a pair of redundant VPN tunnels, to provide customers with the ability to setup separate VPN tunnels to redundant VPN devices. Some customers may have seen one of the two redundant tunnels as unavailable during this time. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

4:29 PM PST We are investigating increased Firehose to Redshift delivery delays in the US-EAST-1 Region. We have identified the root cause and are working towards resolution.
5:43 PM PST We continue to perform recovery work in the US-EAST-1 Region. While the delivery of data to Redshift is delayed, data is durably retained in the Firehose delivery stream and delivery to Redshift will resume once recovery is complete.
7:04 PM PST Between 11:40 AM PDT and 7:00 PM PDT we experienced increased Firehose to Redshift delivery delays in the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service has resumed normal operation.

12:40 PM PST Between 12:17 PM and 12:30 PM PST we experienced impaired Internet connectivity affecting some instances in a single Availability Zone in the eu-west-1 region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

12:32 PM PST We are investigating impaired Internet connectivity affecting some instances in a single Availability Zone in the eu-west-1 region.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Elevated API faults and latencies in US-WEST-1
archive.description: 6:21 PM PDT Between 5:24 PM PDT and 5:52 PM PDT, customers experienced an elevated fault rate when calling the GetMetricStatistics API in the US-WEST-1 Region. Some metrics were delayed, and CloudWatch alarms on delayed metrics transitioned into INSUFFICIENT_DATA state. We have resolved the issue. Delayed metrics will be backfilled in CloudWatch console graphs and for API retrieval. The service is operating normally.

3:10 PM PDT We are investigating an issue with an external provider outside of our network. This may be impacting Internet connectivity between some customer networks and the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region is not impacted by the event.
3:45 PM PDT There are confirmed reports of an issue within an external provider’s network. This issue is impacting Internet connectivity between some customer networks and AWS Services in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region, as well as Internet connectivity to non-AWS locations. We are working with the provider to determine the scope of the problem and time to resolution. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region is not impacted by the event.
4:16 PM PDT We have mitigated the issue by routing around the provider’s network where possible.
4:24 PM PDT Between 2:15 PM PDT and 3:40 PM PDT we experienced an Internet connectivity issue due to an impairment within an external provider’s network which affected traffic from some end-user networks and the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. Connectivity to instances and services within the Region was not impacted by the event. The issue has been resolved and connectivity has been restored.
At 2:15 PM PDT on Friday March 17, AWS started to receive reports of network connectivity issues towards the Sydney AWS region. We were quickly able to isolate the issue to traffic routing via Telstra, traffic via other providers was working correctly. At 3:40 PM PDT we routed traffic away from the Telstra network and service to customers was restored. After further investigation we confirmed the problem was related to a third party provider and not Telstra’s network as was mistakenly stated on the Dashboard. Recovery occurred when the third party corrected their defective routing, not as a result of AWS routing traffic away from the Telstra network.

archive.summary: [RESOLVED] Increased Error Rates for VPC Management Console
archive.description:
11:54 AM PDT We are investigating increased error rates for the VPC Management Console in the EU-WEST-1 Region.
12:34 PM PDT Between 9:00 AM and 12:15 PM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for the VPC Management Console. VPC APIs were not affected. The issue has been resolved the service is operating normally.

10:47 PM PDT We are investigating increased connectivity issues for EC2 instances in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.
11:08 PM PDT We continue to investigate connectivity issues for some instances in a single Availability Zone and increased API error rates for the EC2 APIs in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.
11:49 PM PDT We can confirm that instances have experienced a power event within a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. Error rates for the EC2 APIs have improved and launches of new EC2 instances are succeeding within the other Availability Zones in the Region.
Jun 5, 12:31 AM PDT We have restored power to the affected Availability Zone and are working to restore connectivity to the affected instances.
Jun 5, 1:17 AM PDT We continue to work on restoring connectivity to all instances in the affected Availability Zone. Launches of new EC2 instances are now starting to succeed in the affected Availability Zone but we are experiencing delays in updating instance state data.
Jun 5, 2:47 AM PDT We continue to make progress in restoring connectivity to all instances in the affected Availability Zone. Launches of new EC2 instances are now succeeding in all Availability Zones and instance state data is no longer delayed in the affected Availability Zone.
Jun 5, 4:43 AM PDT Connectivity has been restored for the majority of the instances in the affected Availability Zone and the APIs continue to operate normally. The remaining impacted instances are taking longer to recover. For immediate recovery, we recommend customers that are able to, launch replacement instances.
Jun 5, 11:50 AM PDT On June 4th at 10:25 PM PDT a significant number of EC2 instances and EBS volumes within a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region experienced a loss of power. Beginning at this same time, EC2 API calls in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region experienced increased error rates and latencies as well as delays in propagation of instance state data in the affected Availability Zone. Instances and volumes in the other Availability Zones in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region were unaffected. At 11:46 PM PDT, power was restored to the facility and instances and volumes started to recover. At 1:00 AM PDT, 80% of the affected instances and volumes had been recovered by our automated systems. At 2:45 AM PDT the increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs and the delayed propagation of instance state data were fully resolved. A couple of unexpected issues prevented our automated systems from recovering the remaining instances and volumes. The team was able to fix these issues, and by 8:00 AM PDT, all but a small number of instances and volumes were recovered. Since 8:00 AM PDT our teams have been working to recover these remaining instances and volumes. Most of these instances are hosted on hardware which was adversely affected by the loss of power. While we will continue to work to recover any affected instances or volumes, we recommend replacing any remaining affected instances or volumes if possible.

11:01 PM PDT We are investigating increased connectivity issues for load balancers within the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region.
Jun 5, 1:42 AM PDT We continue to work on resolving the connectivity issues affecting some load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. For load balancers in multiple Availability Zones, request traffic will be routed through the unaffected Availability Zones. We are also experiencing increased provisioning times for load balancers in the affected Availability Zone.
Jun 5, 4:58 AM PDT We continue to work on resolving the connectivity issues affecting some load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. We are also experiencing EC2 instances registration delays for some load balancers, which we are working to resolve.
Jun 5, 8:03 AM PDT Connectivity has been restored for the majority of the load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. We are no longer experiencing delays for the registration of EC2 instances. We continue to work to restore connectivity for the remaining load balancers within the affected Availability Zone.
Jun 5, 8:36 AM PDT Between June 4th at 10:25 PM PDT and June 5th at 8:05 AM PDT we experienced increased connectivity issues for load balancers in a single Availability Zone in the AP-SOUTHEAST-2 Region. During the recovery, we experienced delays in EC2 instance registrations on load balancers in the affected Availability Zone. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
